text: I think the main difference between SQL and other more typical programming languages is that SQL is declarative: you tell it what you want, not how you want it. The database backend comes up with an optimized strategy for you without your knowledge

text: every dialect of SQL is an absolutely horrible language and the only reason it still exists is because of legacy.  I emphatically reject the notion that it is any better than just about any reasonable "high level" language for the tabular stuff it does (it being declarative doesn't require any of its bonkers syntax or conventions)
